thread.title: Former Phoenix fire captain dies of 2009 traffic-accident injuries
thread.title_full: Former Phoenix fire captain dies of 2009 traffic-accident injuries

author: Diego Mendoza-Moyers , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: Former Phoenix fire captain dies of 2009 traffic-accident injuries
text:
Photo provided by Phoenix Fire Department. (Photo: fd) 
580 CONNECT TWEET 8 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE A retired Phoenix Fire Department captain died Saturday night of injuries suffered in a 2009 line-of-duty car accident, according to the Phoenix Fire Department.
Crystal Rezzonico, 56, was in a fire department vehicle when a car collided with the unit in a Phoenix intersection. Rezzonico was ejected from the vehicle during the accident. She broke both of her ankles and suffered a severe traumatic brain injury, according to a statement issued by Captain Rob McDade, a spokesman for the Phoenix Fire Department.
Rezzonico was in a coma for two weeks following the accident in August of 2009. She returned to duty about a year after the accident, following several surgeries and rehabilitation.
After serving 23 years with the department, Rezzonico retired in late 2014.
